page.title: 01GAZETTEER OF WELLINGBOROUGH.
page.content: Wellingborough is a well established market town with a history that can be traced back to the Romans.Since the 1960's it has become an expanding area resulting in the development of new industrial and commercial activities. During this period,the population of the town increased to its present level of 40,000.The population is expected to continue to grow at a steady rate.The town benefits from a covered shopping area,recreational facilities and an extensive range of private and public housing.The town is well connected to the National Road and Railway Networks.It is situated between London and the West Midlands with direct access to a new dual carriageway linking Welling- borough with junction 15 of the M1 via the A45. {
